components.description:
The front page of a newspaper, as people once read the news before the internet. Commonly used for various content concerning news, media, and journalism as well as personal news.

Most platforms depict a nondescript masthead, images, and columns of text. Apple’s newspaper is called The Apple Times, featuring a logo based on its ü¶Ö Eagle and a picture of its üåã Volcano. Facebook’s is called Daily Feed, with a headline “El Capitan” and picture of that famous rock formation in Yosemite National Park. WhatsApp’s paper reads Daily News with a picture of a map.

See also üóûÔ∏è Rolled-Up Newspaper.

title: Newspaper

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.
